title-group.article-title: Some New Error Estimates for Ritz-Galerkin Methods with Minimal Regularity Assumptions

abstract.p: New uniform error estimates are established for finite element approximations u<sub>h</sub> of solutions u of second-order elliptic equations Lu = f using only the regularity assumption |u|<sub>1</sub> ≤ c|f|<sub>-1</sub>. Using an Aubin-Nitsche type duality argument we show for example that, for arbitrary (fixed) ε sufficiently small, there exists an h<sub>0</sub> such that for <latex>$0 < h < h_0$</latex> |u - u<sub>h</sub>|<sub>0</sub> ≤ ε|u - u<sub>h</sub>|<sub>1</sub>. Here, | · |<sub>s</sub> denotes the norm on the Sobolev space H<sup>s</sup>. Other related results are established.
